channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13078] IntegrationTestSendTraceRequests is a noop
item.description: While pair-debugging with Jeffrey Zhong on HBASE-13077, we noticed that IntegrationTestSendTraceRequests doesn't actually assert anything. This test should be converted to use a mini cluster, setup a POJOSpanReceiver, and then verify the spans collected.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: FYI Enis Soztutar

Rehashes IntegrationTestSendTraceRequests:

  • Moves it from hbase-it and into hbase-server as a more normal test (use the normal TestingUtil)
  • Uses LocalFileSpanRecevier instead of POJOSpanReceiver as the latter was having a hard time running (memory pressure, I believe)
  • General code cleanup and more comments.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12724625/HBASE-13078.patch
against master branch at commit f6512065c2ee84a9c5af7d03f674c57c978b0b68.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12724625

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 7 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13664//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13664//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13664//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13664//console

This message is automatically generated.

I believe the original intention of being an IT is that it could be run on a real cluster to verify the tracing deployment is correct.

How many spans is it creating such that it causes memory pressure...?

I believe the original intention of being an IT is that it could be run on a real cluster to verify the tracing deployment is correct.

Oh.. maybe I misinterpreted your comment in the description. "This test should be converted to use a mini cluster" meant to me that it doesn't need to be an IntegrationTest and should just be a normal unit test (since it uses a mini cluster when not using a real cluster).

How many spans is it creating such that it causes memory pressure...?

I see ~80k spans.
Restores the test as an IntegrationTest
0.98 version. Work around htrace-2.0.4 whose LocalFileSpanReceiver doesn't separate span by newline. Instead of really crazy parsing of the file, just copies the span receiver and fixes it.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

This message is automatically generated.
Purge htrace tests altogether? The old stuff has little relation to the new and is not worth salvaging.
You mean the non-incubator "htrace" (only slightly confusing)? Are you suggesting that we just nuke this test completely in 0.98?

Are you suggesting that we just nuke this test completely in 0.98?

Yes. HTrace itself is a little wobbly. It is getting better in incubator but IMO, an IT for the now-dead pre-incubator htrace is of a priority that is so low and for a service being used rarely if at all, i'd suggest best just axe the test.
Per stack's suggestion, patch which removes the test completely from 0.98.

+1

Will commit EOD unless objection.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12724952/HBASE-13078-0.98-removal.patch
against 0.98 branch at commit e75c6201c69e57416525135a397a971ad4d1b902.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13681//console

This message is automatically generated.

My thinking is that we should have both: a medium or large test that verifies a single traced invocation with everything enabled results in spans logged (and perhaps some validation thereof) as well as a smoke test like this one that can be run to validate tracing is configured correctly cluster-wide (ie, and spans are coming out of both hbase and hdfs). Maybe the latter is unreasonable?

Anyway, nice work Josh Elser, +1.

Thanks for taking a look, Nick.

a smoke test like this one that can be run to validate tracing is configured correctly cluster-wide (ie, and spans are coming out of both hbase and hdfs). Maybe the latter is unreasonable?

Difficult, perhaps. The instrumentation in HDFS will (continue to) be a moving target, I imagine. It might be better to get good tests in HDFS to ensure that tracing occurs where desired. If we can guarantee that spans in HDFS make it to the SpanReceiver, we shouldn't need to retest here in HBase.

a medium or large test that verifies a single traced invocation with everything enabled results in spans logged (and perhaps some validation thereof)

Cool, I'll open up another issue for this. Opinions/thoughts on what this would look like are suggested/welcome. At a minimum, I can peruse the usages and try to tailor a test around that.

If we can guarantee that spans in HDFS make it to the SpanReceiver, we shouldn't need to retest here in HBase.

Agreed. My goal isn't to assert specific HDFS behavior, only to be sure we are passing the span context down to HDFS.

Ok, that makes some more sense. I need to look more at how HBase uses the HTrace APIs to see if there is more we can assert over the ThreadLocal used to maintain the current span (assuming that hasn't changed since last I looked at htrace)

Filed HBASE-13458 for this.

We have HBASE-12938 open to potentially resolve the issue with outdated (effectively broken, IMHO) HTrace in 0.98. If the outcome of HBASE-12938 is the HTrace situation in 0.98 isn't worth salvaging or cannot be salvaged, then let's just leave everything there alone.
Hah, small JIRA world. Thanks for the context, I had (re)forgotten about that one.
Friends, any chance we can get this committed in all but 0.98 for now? We can deal with whether or not this makes it into 0.98 after HBASE-12938 like Andrew stated.
+1 on the removal patch. Will commit all around tomorrow unless objection.
Thanks, Stack!
Anoop Sam John Thanks. You applied it everywhere?
Sorry stack not following you. I have not committed this patch any where.
Anoop Sam John A misreading on my part. Sorry about that.
Pushed to branch-1.0, branch-1.1, and to master. 0.98 has its own issue. Thanks for the patch Josh Elser

Heyyyy stack. Looks like you put the removal patch everywhere instead of just 0.98. Didn't we want to keep the test in place for >=1.* and apply HBASE-13078-v1.patch which adds in assertions?

Josh Elser Oh. Ok. I suppose my thinking was that htrace has changed so radically since 3.14 that we'd just need a new test anyways... Maybe I should open new issue to add an implementation that works w/ new htrace?

htrace has changed so radically since 3.14 that we'd just need a new test anyways... Maybe I should open new issue to add an implementation that works w/ new htrace?

Perhaps? At least in adding assertions to the existing test, things were operating as expected and it seemed like a good enough test to me. I defer to you (or anyone else more knowledgeable) on the subject though...

Ok. I put back the test on master and branch-1 but not on branch-1.1 nor branch-1.0. The hope is that we'll be up on a htrace 3.2 by the time 1.2 hbase comes out and then this test will have more to chew on. Thanks for following up Josh Elser
Boss. Thanks for the (continued) help, Stack.

Best as I can tell, we landed the test fix on 1.0.x and 1.1.y here (no idea what the values of 'X' and 'Y' were when it first appeared anymore).

HBASE-12938 was closed as "later" so the 0.98 branch changes can similarly be treated as "later".

Closing this one to prevent later headache/confusion over what was done/needs to happen.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Test removed from 0.98, 1.0, and 1.1, but left in place on master and branch-1.
